metadata.title: CVE-2023-43622 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description: An attacker, opening a HTTP/2 connection with an initial window size of 0,was able to block handling of that connection indefinitely in Apache HTTPServer. This could be used to exhaust worker resources in the server,similar to the well known "slow loris" attack pattern. This has been fixedin version 2.4.58, so that such connection are terminated properly afterthe configured connection timeout. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server:from 2.4.55 through 2.4.57. Users are recommended to upgrade to version2.4.58, which fixes the issue.

criterions.comment: apache2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
